titlestmt.titleproper: Western Ways writers and photographers have told the world about Sonora in national magazines, newspapers, and trade journals: here is the record 1940-1956
Western Ways writers and photographers have told the world about Sonora in national magazines, newspapers, and trade journals: here is the record

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Western Ways writers and photographers have told the world about Sonora in national magazines, newspapers, and trade journals: here is the record 1940-1956
did.abstract: One scrapbook of newspaper and magazine articles about travel and recreation in Sonora, Mexico, 1940-1956; written and photographed by Western Ways staff and their associates. Includes color illustrations as well as black-and-white illustrations and original photographs. Some articles discuss aspects of local history and culture, such as jumping beans, festivals, and Spanish missions.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Western Ways writers and photographers have told the world about Sonora in national magazines, newspapers, and trade journals: here is the record (MS 170). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Photographer and founder of Western Ways Feature Service, Tucson, Arizona, a commercial photography firm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: One scrapbook of newspaper and magazine articles about travel and recreation in Sonora, Mexico, 1940-1956; written and photographed by Western Ways staff and their associates. Includes color illustrations as well as black-and-white illustrations and original photographs. Some articles discuss aspects of local history and culture, such as jumping beans, festivals, and Spanish missions.
